intro: Notylia latilabia, commonly known as the broad-lipped notylia, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a smooth surface with a glossy appearance. Notylia latilabia is adapted to moist environments and plays a role in supporting local insect populations.
